Indonesia. The Family Nutrition Improvement programme (UPGK), also known as the Posyandu 
(weighing post) programme, started around 1979 and expanded to national coverage, continuing 
until constrained by an economic crisis in the late 1990s. From 1975â€“1990 coverage was 
approximately 90% by area (58 000/65 000 villages) ( 22, 43, 44 ). The number of children per 
posyandu was about 60.1 Rohde (45) refers to five CHN
